channel.title: How Much Do You Think It Would Cost To Buy The Rights To Runescape Classic?
channel.description: Would Jagex even ever give it up?

item.title: How Much Do You Think It Would Cost To Buy The Rights To Runescape Classic?
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“Justin Bieber, post:19, topic:552984”][quote author=sk8rdude461 link=topic=671896.msg4494131#msg4494131 date=1440423147]

[quote author=Justin Bieber link=topic=671896.msg4494127#msg4494127 date=1440417740]

It wouldnt matter. I can replicate any image and say its my own because I created it. Same with the landscape, as long as you create it, or in this case change it so drastically that it looks like you created it, then it’s yours.

Look at minecraft and the offbrand replicas. You can replicate whatever you want, as long as it’s your “creation”

Ideas cannot be copyrighted, only the result of those ideas.

sorry to inform you but ideas can be copyrighted there is a person in the USA who copyrighted a lot of ideas and different things and made millions, if you were to make a game and have items rune black mith ect… u could be sued same with landscape even if, thats like me copying some ones song and changing a few things its still copying and people have been sued be for
[/quote]are you sure you’re not thinking of patents? if two people produce a piece of similar artwork independently, you can’t just accuse one of copyright theft.

You should look up copyright infringment cases related to art and computer programs.

en.wikipedia.org

Whelan v. Jaslow

Whelan Assocs., Inc. v. Jaslow Dental Laboratory, Inc. (3rd Cir. 1986) was a landmark case in defining principles that applied to copyright of computer software in the United States, extending beyond literal copying of the text to copying the more abstract structure, sequence and organization. The decision initiated a six-year period (until Computer Associates Int. Inc. v. Altai Inc.) of excessive copyright protection, suppressing innovation. In 1978 Rand Jaslow tried to build a computer progra...


^In this case the guy writes a program in a completely different language but has too many similar functionalities of the software he copied.
[/quote]the original author re-wrote the exact same thing in a different language, dropped a single character from the name, and marketed it as a successor to the original piece software. i’m no lawyer but that shit sounds like a very simple and genuine case of copyright theft.[/quote]
That was one example of many.
The point behind it was to prove that even if you’re not using the same programming language, if your concept is too similar (I think copying runescape’s landscape and map design would be too similar) then you can still get caught for copyright infringement.

Read full topic
item.source: How Much Do You Think It Would Cost To Buy The Rights To Runescape Classic?

It wouldnt matter. I can replicate any image and say its my own because I created it. Same with the landscape, as long as you create it, or in this case change it so drastically that it looks like you created it, then it’s yours.

Look at minecraft and the offbrand replicas. You can replicate whatever you want, as long as it’s your “creation”

Ideas cannot be copyrighted, only the result of those ideas.

sorry to inform you but ideas can be copyrighted there is a person in the USA who copyrighted a lot of ideas and different things and made millions, if you were to make a game and have items rune black mith ect… u could be sued same with landscape even if, thats like me copying some ones song and changing a few things its still copying and people have been sued be for
[/quote]are you sure you’re not thinking of patents? if two people produce a piece of similar artwork independently, you can’t just accuse one of copyright theft.

You should look up copyright infringment cases related to art and computer programs.

en.wikipedia.org

Whelan v. Jaslow

Whelan Assocs., Inc. v. Jaslow Dental Laboratory, Inc. (3rd Cir. 1986) was a landmark case in defining principles that applied to copyright of computer software in the United States, extending beyond literal copying of the text to copying the more abstract structure, sequence and organization. The decision initiated a six-year period (until Computer Associates Int. Inc. v. Altai Inc.) of excessive copyright protection, suppressing innovation. In 1978 Rand Jaslow tried to build a computer progra...


^In this case the guy writes a program in a completely different language but has too many similar functionalities of the software he copied.
[/quote]the original author re-wrote the exact same thing in a different language, dropped a single character from the name, and marketed it as a successor to the original piece software. i’m no lawyer but that shit sounds like a very simple and genuine case of copyright theft.[/quote]

Basically if this was to happen with runescape all you need to do to get sued is this.
Code the shit in a © based language if you feeling saucy and has happened in this forum (3) times?
Then name the game “Runecape” and get sued.

Read full topic

sorry to inform you but ideas can be copyrighted there is a person in the USA who copyrighted a lot of ideas and different things and made millions, if you were to make a game and have items rune black mith ect… u could be sued same with landscape even if, thats like me copying some ones song and changing a few things its still copying and people have been sued be for

item.title: How Much Do You Think It Would Cost To Buy The Rights To Runescape Classic?
item.dc:creator: @Rodgerwilco Rodgerwilco
item.description:
@Rodgerwilco wrote:

[quote=“Kaibutzu, post:13, topic:552984”][quote author=Rodgerwilco link=topic=671896.msg4494095#msg4494095 date=1440400176]
It wouldnt matter. I can replicate any image and say its my own because I created it. Same with the landscape, as long as you create it, or in this case change it so drastically that it looks like you created it, then it’s yours.

Look at minecraft and the offbrand replicas. You can replicate whatever you want, as long as it’s your “creation”

Ideas cannot be copyrighted, only the result of those ideas.
[/quote]

sorry to inform you but ideas can be copyrighted there is a person in the USA who copyrighted a lot of ideas and different things and made millions, if you were to make a game and have items rune black mith ect… u could be sued same with landscape even if, thats like me copying some ones song and changing a few things its still copying and people have been sued be for[/quote]

The way it works, is you have to have a detailed plan of how you’re doing the idea. Then you have a certain amount of time to create what you patented or its thrown out the window. This is why there are so many different door handles, the door handles have the same purpose but they were designed/functions are different.

[quote="-Nothing, post:15, topic:552984"][quote author=Rodgerwilco link=topic=671896.msg4494095#msg4494095 date=1440400176]
It wouldnt matter. I can replicate any image and say its my own because I created it. Same with the landscape, as long as you create it, or in this case change it so drastically that it looks like you created it, then it’s yours.

Look at minecraft and the offbrand replicas. You can replicate whatever you want, as long as it’s your “creation”

Ideas cannot be copyrighted, only the result of those ideas.
[/quote]
I’m writing this reply solely on the answers I have got while I asked around while doing the project; You can make a game exactly like RSC but you would need different artwork including landscape, you can’t make exact same copy as I had planned. You can take bits and pieces from the original landscape but most of it must be your work.[/quote]

Just shifting the color values and keeping the “design” the same with the combination of a different format and the way the client handles it as I mentioned earlier is enough. If you’re in court, you just pull up google earth and show in real life locations of where you got it from. You’re going to be sued for replicating designs on google earth? They are making a mockery of the court system your honor and I demand all fees for this nonsense to be covered by the opposite party. You can make up any reason for why you came up with the design and act stupid. What it would come down to is the amount of tiles, width/height of some locations in the world. If you show 10 tiles from a wall to the water and they have the same thing, you would need to change it. Those small changes will make the difference because the judge will be looking at those calculations.

Read full topic
item.source: How Much Do You Think It Would Cost To Buy The Rights To Runescape Classic?

Look at minecraft and the offbrand replicas. You can replicate whatever you want, as long as it’s your “creation”

Ideas cannot be copyrighted, only the result of those ideas.

sorry to inform you but ideas can be copyrighted there is a person in the USA who copyrighted a lot of ideas and different things and made millions, if you were to make a game and have items rune black mith ect… u could be sued same with landscape even if, thats like me copying some ones song and changing a few things its still copying and people have been sued be for
[/quote]are you sure you’re not thinking of patents? if two people produce a piece of similar artwork independently, you can’t just accuse one of copyright theft.[/quote]
You should look up copyright infringment cases related to art and computer programs.

en.wikipedia.org

Whelan v. Jaslow

Whelan Assocs., Inc. v. Jaslow Dental Laboratory, Inc. (3rd Cir. 1986) was a landmark case in defining principles that applied to copyright of computer software in the United States, extending beyond literal copying of the text to copying the more abstract structure, sequence and organization. The decision initiated a six-year period (until Computer Associates Int. Inc. v. Altai Inc.) of excessive copyright protection, suppressing innovation. In 1978 Rand Jaslow tried to build a computer progra...


^In this case the guy writes a program in a completely different language but has too many similar functionalities of the software he copied.

[quote=“Rodgerwilco, post:12, topic:552984”]It wouldnt matter. I can replicate any image and say its my own because I created it. Same with the landscape, as long as you create it, or in this case change it so drastically that it looks like you created it, then it’s yours.

Look at minecraft and the offbrand replicas. You can replicate whatever you want, as long as it’s your “creation”

Ideas cannot be copyrighted, only the result of those ideas.[/quote]
I’m writing this reply solely on the answers I have got while I asked around while doing the project; You can make a game exactly like RSC but you would need different artwork including landscape, you can’t make exact same copy as I had planned. You can take bits and pieces from the original landscape but most of it must be your work.

item.title: How Much Do You Think It Would Cost To Buy The Rights To Runescape Classic?
item.dc:creator: @Nothing1 -Nothing
item.description:
@Nothing1 wrote:

Rodgerwilco:

You can copy the landscape, you just can’t distribute it in .jag format & use it the same way their client handles it (the way the client loads sections) but you could replicate it on your own terms and it’s your creation.

The terrain of RSC is considered artwork, I don’t think converting the terrain to any format will make a difference. I believe that even after heavy conversion and scaling which you can see on the second picture, it will still count as theirs.

Read full topic

item.title: How Much Do You Think It Would Cost To Buy The Rights To Runescape Classic?
item.dc:creator: @Nothing1 -Nothing
item.description:
@Nothing1 wrote:

[quote=“RSCShadow, post:8, topic:552984”][quote author=Godandjesus link=topic=671896.msg4493422#msg4493422 date=1439720455]
Why would you even want to buy it? It’s a shitty game. You can hire bunch of Chinese developers to make RSC-like game much cheaper, with 3-hit system and all that shit.
[/quote]You could even copy the landscape and items so long as pictures and examines are different.[/quote]
You can’t directly copy their landscape as far as I know. Hence why I scrapped this project:

4309962319cd8473a36bd39501af4356.gif800×450

de504b19d91de5ac15927ca7a8eebd6d.jpg1282×723

Instead of re-inventing the wheel I’m going to go for something different entirely

item.title: How Much Do You Think It Would Cost To Buy The Rights To Runescape Classic?
item.dc:creator: @xx_matty_xx Justin Bieber
item.description:
@xx_matty_xx wrote:

surely there would be a lot of legal risk for jagex to sell all the rights to rsc, considering it has runescape branding all over it and so many similarities to rs2? not saying it couldn’t be worked out, but if I was them I’d want a lot of money to cover lawyers and all that risk. you could also shit all over their brand and they wouldn’t be able to do anything about it.

Read full topic

“It contains software still used today”
